title: On Our Watch: Perceived Threat
description: Episode four of On Our Watch from NPR and KQED investigates the case of a plainclothes Stockton police officer who grabbed a Black 16-year-old, took him to the ground and punched him, knocking the teen's two front teeth onto a convenience store floor.
copyright: Copyright 2020-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: On Our Watch: Perceived Threat
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Experts say that the internal affairs system is poorly equipped to hold officers accountable for racist policing unless it is overt and extreme.
itunes:subtitle: Experts say that the internal affairs system is poorly equipped to hold officers accountable for racist policing unless it is overt and extreme.
content:encoded: Episode four of On Our Watch from NPR and KQED investigates the case of a plainclothes Stockton police officer who grabbed a Black 16-year-old, took him to the ground and punched him, knocking the teen's two front teeth onto a convenience store floor.
